frame.name: Conditional_occurrence
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Consequence</fen> is presented as occurring if the <fen>Profiled_possibility</fen> occurs. See Conditional_scenario for further information.
<ex><t>If</t> <fex name="Profiled_possibility">you take too long</fex> , <fex name="Consequence">the train will leave without you</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Profiled_possibility
FE.definition: <def-root>The situation presented explicitly as a possibility, contrasting with the implicit Negated_possibility.</def-root>

FE.name: Pragmatic_marker
FE.definition: <def-root>Pragmatically emphasizes a speaker's assumption of the truth of the <fen>Profiled_possibility</fen> for the conversation's duration. This FE does not occur for all LUs in the frame, and is closed-class, limited to the word 'always'. </def-root>
